basics.name: Josh Fisher
basics.label: Development Operations Engineer
basics.summary: Over the past 5 years I have continuously challenged myself to learn new languages, frameworks, tools and methodologies. I had the first legal Bitcoin ATM in the state of Oregon in 2014 and since then, have been living and breathing the technology and software underlying cryptocurrency. I learn and build out of curiousity and necessity.

work.summary: Launched the first Bitcoin ATM to be legally approved by the State of Oregon Division of Fincial Regulation in 2014, exited and sold the machines and business process in the latter half of 2017.
highlights: Legal State Approval in a nascent technology 3 years before the first big boom (now)
Banking Secrecy Act Standard Operating Principles and Procedures adhering to all Federal and State law
Machine placement and contract negotiations with business owners
Live customer service chat implementation and operation to aid in new customer onboarding and ongoing customer service
Access control with HSM (Yubikey) and OpenPGP used as SSH
Critical information backup and disaster recovery systems and process implementation
Security of bitcoin hot-wallet on Amazon AWS with zero hacks or thefts in 3 years of operations with significant bitcoin value as a target
Social media and marketing materials creation
Negotiation of terms relating to business entity sale, including all IP, operating procedures and compliance operations

work.summary: General title and due diligence rerporting of all mineral, as well as surface rights for energy industry production or supply line purposes.
highlights: S-T-R From Government issued patent title
Provability of title ownership through chain of title reports
Right of way research for Pipeline XXL
Responsible for finding and fixing probate and title continuty errors for chain of title continuity purposes

work.summary: General land invetment trust, bought distressed properties in 2008 crash to rehabilitate and rent long-term, management is overseen by my younger brother whom lives in OKC.
highlights: Resource allocation for long-term maintenance and utility operations
